programme.title: Xploration DIY Sci S5 - "Science Fair"
programme.desc: Steve Spangler’s sidekick Higginsworth panics when he has to deliver a science fair project.

programme.title: Xploration DIY Sci S5 - "Museum Of Science, Boston #2"
programme.desc: Host Steve Spangler and his sidekick Higginsworth return to the Museum of Science, Boston, where they take simple demonstrations they’ve done on DIY Sci and make them gigantic!

programme.title: Xploration DIY Sci S5 - "Inclusion"
programme.desc: For first time in his career as an educator, host Steve Spangler is invited to teach a class of kids who are blind or visually impaired.

programme.title: TechKnow S1 - "The Science Of Sugar"
programme.desc: Exploring the correlation between sugar intake and heart disease in young adults.

programme.title: TechKnow S1 - "Saving The Reef"
programme.desc: A look at how cross-breeding and manipulating corals to withstand warmer sea temperatures and more acidic condition could save coral reefs.

programme.title: TechKnow S1 - "Capturing Carbon"
programme.desc: A look at the science behind curtailing the dangerous effects of climate change by capturing CO2 and converting it into useable products.

programme.title: TechKnow S1 - "Disabled Life Enhancements"
programme.desc: Techknow looks at innovative solutions for accessibility and assistive technology to help persons with disabilities.

programme.title: VR 101 S1 - "Education"
programme.desc: Can students just simply put on VR headsets and “attend”class from the comfort of their own homes? In this episode, we take a look at some of the latest VR apps for school education and after school VR games.

programme.title: VR 101 S1 - "Safety"
programme.desc: VR can be used in practical applications like training and road safety, but find out how that sensory overload can lead to error in judgment.

programme.title: VR 101 S1 - "Gaming"
programme.desc: This episode looks at the development of VR content and hardware meant to improve on the ‘reality’ of VR and the latest games featuring novel and exciting virtual worlds.

programme.title: VR 101 S1 - "TV&Film"
programme.desc: The art of moving visuals has long been used to evoke emotion and empathy in the viewer. Film and TV productions are implementing VR to give viewers an immersive experience where it’s just like “being there”.

programme.title: Quick Connections with Alie Ward S1 - "Engineering Earth"
programme.desc: A heroic bid for freedom by an enslaved couple in 19th century America precipitates great innovation that culminates in people literally making heavens open. But can controlling the weather save us from climate catastrophe? Or are we playing god?

programme.title: Bright Now S1 - "New Firefighting Tech"
programme.desc: Firefighters have relied on the same basic tools for decades. But former NASA engineer Mike Ralston hopes to change that with a new breed of emergency vehicle.

programme.title: Trajectory S1 - "More about Mars"
programme.desc: PROJECT GEMINI ADVANCES - NASA refines the techniques needed for rendezvous. CASSINI AT SATURN - In the Cassini probe’s final years of activity, its handlers are asking it to do more complex and risky assignments.

programme.title: Trajectory S1 - "Swarm"
programme.desc: PROJECT GEMINI DOCKING AND EVA - In the final phase of the Gemini program NASA struggles with docking and spacewalks. CURIOUSITY ROVING MARS - On the surface of Mars the Curiousity rover is changing the way we think about the red planet.

programme.title: Trajectory S1 - "Planck"
programme.desc: THE APOLLO PROGRAM BEGINS - At the very beginning of NASA’s moon project things go wrong. CAVES - ESA’s special training program for astronauts. PLANCK - Mapping the Cosmic Microwave Background Radiation.

programme.title: Trajectory S1 - "Zero Gravity Training"
programme.desc: REBUILDING PROJECT APOLLO - After the Apollo 1 disaster NASA resumes manned space flight. ORBITING CARBON OBSERVATORY 2 - Monitoring the Earth’s CO2 levels in unprecedented detail. ZERO GRAVITY TRAINING - Parabolic flights and their role in training.

programme.title: Survival Science S1 - "Surviving a Bear Attack"
programme.desc: Nick and Laura create kick-ass tests to explore the immense power and startling speed of grizzly bears. They use Hollywood stunt tools to experience an attack. Then try to recreate a “miracle” arrow shot that saved a man from being killed by a bear.

programme.title: Survival Science S1 - "Surviving Treestand Accidents"
programme.desc: In this exciting episode we’ll find out the reasons why tree stand accidents happen and how we can prevent them. Cool science mixed with dynamic experiments send our hosts, our stunt team and our special crash test dummies plummeting to the ground.

programme.title: Survival Science S1 - "Sniper Attack"
programme.desc: Military snipers are trained in a variety of skills: detection, stalking, camouflage, infiltration, special reconnaissance and target acquisition. Bottom line, a ton of cool shooting and science for Nick and Laura to explore!

programme.title: Survival Science S1 - "Surviving a Lightning Strike"
programme.desc: Laura and Nick travel to a state-of-the-art Direct Effects Lightning Test Lab. With some “explosive” experiments, they’ll determine the power lightning and how it behaves? And they’ll find out how can hunters and fishermen best protect themselves?

programme.title: Engineering the Future S1 - "Wind"
programme.desc: This film follows the race to generate vast power from thin air - the wind. One of the world's biggest windfarms is being built off the English coast.

programme.title: Engineering the Future S1 - "Aviation"
programme.desc: The way we fly about to change, driven by a new breed of aviators not afraid to think differently. Could the days of the jet age be numbered?

programme.title: Engineering the Future S1 - "Fusion"
programme.desc: It is the greatest technological challenge ever undertaken by humankind. The quest to produce the ultimate energy solution... fusion.

programme.title: Engineering the Future S1 - "Tidal"
programme.desc: The power of the ocean's tides is the last great untapped energy source on Earth. Teams of engineers race to perfect the technology to harness the vast flowers of water.

programme.title: The Lightbulb Moment S1 - "MAUVE"
programme.desc: In 1856, a chemistry student accidentally created a strange substance with a rich purple hue -- the world’s first synthetic dye. In just a few years, ‘Mauve’ would take over the fashion industry and enable stunning advances in medicine.

programme.title: The Lightbulb Moment S1 - "VANILLA"
programme.desc: In 1841 on the small island of Réunion, a 12-year-old slave did something no one had done before; artificially pollinate the vanilla plant. The vanilla bean took the world by storm, sparking the artificial flavor revolution and changing how we eat.

programme.title: The Lightbulb Moment S1 - "WIFI"
programme.desc: Actress Hedy Lamarr, “the world's most beautiful woman,” had a knack for inventing. During WWII, in an effort to help the Allies, she devised a technology designed to intercept Axis communications – and created the foundation of wireless internet.

programme.title: The Lightbulb Moment S1 - "STREAMING"
programme.desc: The early days of online video were plagued by low resolution and unbearable buffering times. But one day that all changed. In the late 90s, a breakthrough technology revolutionized streaming video, setting the foundation for the era of Netflix.

programme.title: Unearth S1 - "Life Beyond Earth"
programme.desc: We look closely at the search within our solar system, Mars, Titan and the ice moons. Speaking with experts in their fields of Mars robotic missions, Nuclear scientists probing the structure of ice on the distant moons.

programme.title: Unearth S1 - "The Next Great Extinction Event"
programme.desc: Experts explain our history and evolution of Earth over its 4 billion year history and take us through to the current emergency where humans may be one of the species to become extinct.

programme.title: Unearth S1 - "A.I. The Code For Consiousness?"
programme.desc: Hollywood has made us rather fearful of Artificial Intelligence, or A.I. But as we shall see, A.I. and its dance partner robotics might not be the nemesis we should fear; at least, not if we get them right.

programme.title: Unearth S1 - "Germ Warefare"
programme.desc: A new enemy is emerging. This new enemy is the natural world itself, a microscopic realm of bacteria. And not just any bacteria, but the so-called super-bugs. We'll look at the emerging threats and what scientists are doing to counter them.

programme.title: The World of Bridges S1 - "China"
programme.desc: We visit China's most famous Wind and Rain Bridge and the Ponte dei Salti in the Verzasca Valley that literally dates back to the Roman era.

programme.title: The World of Bridges S1 - "Wales"
programme.desc: The Millau Viaduct in the south of France is one of the highest bridge structures in the world while the Pontcysyllte Aqueduct, which stands high over the River Dee in northeast Wales, was built in the 19th century.

programme.title: The World of Bridges S1 - "India"
programme.desc: One of the most impressive steel bridges in the world can be found in Calcutta: the Howrah Bridge. Its predecessor is the Forth Bridge across the Firth of Forth, near the Scottish capital of Edinburgh.

programme.title: The World of Bridges S1 - "Zimbabwe"
programme.desc: The Great Seto Bridge in Japan and the Victoria Falls Bridge in Zimbabwe have more than one thing in common: they were built on dreams and are the only train connections between the two regions.

programme.title: How Do They Do It S14 - "Iron Ore, Wave Flume, Chandeliers"
programme.desc: How do they extract iron ore from one of the most remote mines on the planet? And how do they make chandeliers that are fit for a queen?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S14 - "Oyster Knives, Stadium Lights, Diamonds"
programme.desc: How do they forge the blades to crack open oyster shells? Plus, how do scientists in a lab grow the synthetic diamonds of the future?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S14 - "Cheddar Cheese, CPR Mannequins, Dishwashers"
programme.desc: How do they make cheddar, the world's most popular cheese? How do they breathe life into Rususci Anne - the plastic woman that teaches CPR?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S14 - "Ford Transits, Driza-bone, Saltfish"
programme.desc: How do Ford produce the ubiquitous white van, the Transit? Plus, how do they ensure the Driza-bone coat lives up to its name?
